The translation provided maintains the original meaning but changes the sentence structure by placing "Unfortunately" at the beginning, followed by the main clause with its subordinate clause introduced by "He was a victim of his own success and has now lost it all." In summary, the key differences between the two sentences are:

source: Some time ago, it still seemed that US-Russia relations were turning from cold to hot.
translation_clean:
Translate the following text from en to fi: Some time ago, it still seemed that US-Russia relations were turning from cold to hot. But then came the crisis of Ukraine and now there is no chance for a new era in this relationship.
This crisis has been going on since 2013-2014 when Russia annexed Crimea and started a war with Ukraine. The conflict was fueled by Russia’s aggressive actions against Georgia and Moldova as well as its support of separatists in Eastern Ukraine.
The United States has always supported Ukraine and stood up to Russia. But we are not ready to go into an open confrontation with Russia.
We need to find some way out of this situation because if we do not, Russia will continue to expand its influence in eastern Europe and Asia. This would be bad news for all our allies.
It is very important to have a peaceful resolution to this problem. We should avoid any military action and work towards a diplomatic solution.
There is also a risk of escalation of tensions between China and Japan over disputed islands in the East China Sea. This could lead to further conflicts in the region.
In conclusion, the current situation requires us to take steps towards peace and stability in the region. We cannot afford to let Russia dominate eastern Europe
reference: Vielä jokin aika sitten näytti siltä, että Yhdysvaltain ja Venäjän väliset suhteet ovat matkalla kylmästä lämpimään.

source: When meeting at the G20 summit in Hamburg, Donald Trump, the President of the USA, and Vladimir Putin, the President of Russia, seemed to get along nicely.
translation_clean:
Translate the following text from en to fi: When meeting at the G20 summit in Hamburg, Donald Trump, the President of the USA, and Vladimir Putin, the President of Russia, seemed to get along nicely. However, it was not always so. They were at loggerheads over several issues including Syria, Ukraine, and Iran.
The situation is a bit complicated, as both countries are involved in numerous ongoing conflicts around the world. It seems that they have been trying to resolve their differences through diplomatic means for years now.
Trump has also faced criticism from his own party members for his handling of the situation. The media has accused him of being weak on foreign policy matters, which led to calls for him to be removed from office by some of his critics.
In addition, Trump's relationship with North Korea remains tense despite the recent nuclear agreement between the two countries. The US president still maintains an extremely hostile attitude towards Pyongyang.
Despite all this, Trump and Putin seem to be able to maintain good relations, especially when dealing with other nations. For example, they managed to secure a ceasefire deal in Syria last year.
